resources.string: Not enough memory. Application will be closed.
Do not change your medications or dosage based on these numbers. Always talk to your doctor first.
Your watch requires bluetooth connection with your phone for calibration and data sync. Tap Ok to connect your watch to the phone via Galaxy Wearable app and try again.

No compatible watch found. Samsung HealthMonitor requires a paired Samsung Galaxy Watch.
Allow this app to write Samsung Health data.
"Samsung Health Monitor requires you to set up a lock screen type that is not set to 'Swipe' or 'None'. Change the lock screen type and try again."
By tapping finish, I agree to the Samsung Health Monitor’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
Use this watch to measure your blood pressure.
This app requires a paired compatible Samsung Galaxy Watch to work. You can get an overview of the app by continuing without a paired compatible watch.
"By tapping Continue, I agree to the Samsung Health Monitor's" Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
You must agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy to continue using Samsung Health Monitor.
Are you sure you want to exit?
Learn how to measure blood pressure on your Galaxy Watch.

When a Bluetooth connection is established between your Galaxy Watch and the Galaxy phone you used to calibrate the Galaxy Watch, your measurement results are synced to the BP App on the Galaxy phone. You can share this information with your doctor for review or consultation.
Note: How many results you can store on your Galaxy phone depends on the amount of storage memory your Galaxy phone has.
Measuring your blood pressure using your Galaxy Watch

After you have calibrated your Galaxy Watch with the FDA-cleared upper-arm, cuff-based blood pressure monitor, you are ready to use the BP App on your Galaxy Watch to measure your blood pressure. You will not need to use the cuff-based monitor again until the next calibration in 28 days.
To ensure a more accurate blood pressure measurement, do the following:
Wear your Galaxy Watch on the same wrist as during the calibration and make sure the Galaxy Watch strap is snug around your wrist, but not too tight.
During the measurement, breathe normally. Do not try to deepen or slow down your breath.
30 minutes before doing the measurement, do not have any alcohol or caffeine, and do not smoke, exercise, or bathe.
Make sure your arm and wrist are dry and free of excessive perspiration or skin lotion.
Do the measurement indoors in a quiet place.
Put a comfortable chair next to a table.
Sit in the chair with your back well-supported, your legs uncrossed, and your feet flat on the ground.
Let your hands and forearms rest on the table.
Rest in this position for at least 5 minutes before starting the measurement.
When you start the measurement, stay still and do not move your arm or talk while the Galaxy Watch takes the measurement.
Press the Measure button on the Galaxy Watch.
If the measurement is successful, blood pressure measurements including systolic and diastolic readings appear on the Galaxy Watch face.
If the measurement is unsuccessful (for example, because you moved or because the signal was not strong enough), the Galaxy Watch displays an error message.
To ensure more accurate calibration, do the following:
30 minutes before doing the calibration, do not have any alcohol or caffeine, and do not smoke, exercise, or bathe.
Make sure your arm and wrist are dry and free of excessive perspiration or skin lotion.
Do the calibration indoors in a quiet place.
Put a comfortable chair next to a table.
Sit in the chair with your back well-supported, your legs uncrossed, and your feet flat on the ground.
Let your hands and forearms rest on the table.
Rest in this position for at least 5 minutes before starting the calibration.
When you start the calibration, stay still and do not move your arm or talk while the cuff-based blood pressure monitor performs the measurement.
During the measurement, breathe normally. Do not try to deepen or slow down your breath.
Place the blood pressure cuff on an upper arm.
Wear the Samsung Galaxy Watch on the wrist of the other arm. Make sure the Galaxy Watch strap is snug around your wrist, but not too tight.
Place your Galaxy phone on the table, within easy reach.
On your Galaxy phone, open the BP App and follow the onscreen instructions to do the following:
Start the blood pressure measurement on the cuff-based blood pressure monitor.
Measurement on the Galaxy Watch will begin automatically.
Enter the cuff-based blood pressure monitor reading in the phone BP App.
Repeat Steps a.-c. two more times (for a total of three measurements) to finish the Galaxy Watch calibration.

Note: Make sure that you finish the three measurements required for calibration within 3 days. To keep your Galaxy Watch properly calibrated, you must calibrate it every 28 days, as directed by the BP App. You may also calibrate your Galaxy Watch any time before then by selecting %s from the menu on the Blood Pressure History screen.
" During calibration, the app's calibration range for blood-pressure readings is as follows:"

To ensure more accurate measurements, be sure to calibrate your Galaxy Watch with an FDA-cleared upper-arm, cuff-based blood pressure monitor. Before you start the calibration, read the instructions that accompany the blood pressure monitor and make sure you know how to use it.
Before you can start measuring your blood pressure using the Blood Pressure application (BP App), you must set up your BP App profile and calibrate your Galaxy Watch.
Ensure that your Galaxy Watch is compatible with the BP App.
Ensure that your Galaxy Watch is paired via Bluetooth with the Galaxy phone you will use for your blood pressure measurements.
If the BP App is installed on your Galaxy Watch, open the BP App and follow the onscreen set-up instructions.
To set up the BP App Profile
Download the Samsung Health Monitor App from the Google Play Store or the Galaxy Store.
Complete and confirm the profile set-up and agree to the terms of use.
Select the Blood Pressure option and calibrate your Galaxy Watch.
Setting up the Blood Pressure application
Android SQLite API based on SQLCipher

After the BP App on the Galaxy Watch successfully measures your blood pressure, the Galaxy Watch and the Galaxy phone display the following results:
Do not change your medications or dosage based on these numbers. Always talk to your doctor first.
" For On-Demand measurement, the app's measurement range for blood-pressure readings is as follows:"
*Individuals with Systolic BP and Diastolic BP in 2 categories should be designated to the higher BP category.
Source: ACC/AHA 2017 High Blood Pressure Clinical Practice Guideline
Blood pressure classification* in adults (age 22 and above)
"The value you entered falls outside the app's calibration range. Check your blood pressure monitor to confirm that this value is correct."
The systolic value cannot be less than the diastolic value.
"The BP reading falls outside the app's calibration range. Re-measure with a cuff-based blood pressure monitor."
If you are experiencing unusual symptoms, call your doctor or local emergency services.

"Blood pressure is a vital indicator of your health. Almost half of American adults have high blood pressure, the leading cause of heart disease and stroke with roughly half of the cases uncontrolled and many undiagnosed.
Regularly monitoring your blood pressure using conventional cuff-based methods can be inconvenient and awkward. Samsung brings you this first-of-its-kind, personalized technology to help you easily monitor your blood pressure quickly and comfortably with your Samsung wearable."
Are you sure you want to take the last calibration measurement later?
Make sure the watch is snug on your non-dominant wrist.
Make sure you are wearing your watch and cuff correctly.
Make sure your blood pressure monitor has started.
Your watch cannot take a blood pressure measurement until calibration is finished.
Your watch will use this reading for calibration.
Is there a reading displayed on your blood pressure monitor?
You will restart the calibration measurement.

The BP Monitor app on your watch is closed. You will need to retake this measurement.
Battery too low. Charge your watch and try again.
"There's not enough space on your watch. Delete some files or unused apps and try again."
Make sure sensor is clean and the watch is snug on your wrist.
Try to not move or talk. Sit quietly and try again.
Remove your watch, rub the wrist gently to warm up the skin and try again.
Make sure the watch is snug on your wrist.
Put on your watch and try again.
Clotting disorder or you are taking prescribed blood thinners
Peripheral vascular disease or compromised circulation
Prior heart failure or heart attack
Valvular disease (diseases concerning the aortic valve)
Overview of the calibration process of your watch:
To continue taking blood pressure measurements on your watch, recalibrate your watch in 1 day.
To continue taking blood pressure measurements on your watch, recalibrate your watch in %d days.
To continue taking blood pressure measurements on your watch, recalibrate your watch in today.

You must be at least 22 years old

The blood pressure feature requires a Galaxy Watch Active 2 or later to work.
Start your Blood Pressure Monitor now.
Take three simultaneous measurements on your watch and Blood Pressure Monitor:
You will follow instructions within the phone app to take 3 measurements on your blood pressure cuff.
You will need a valid blood pressure monitor.
You will need to wear your watch during this time, so it can be calibrated.
Your watch measurement is in progress, sit still and relax.
Your watch will start measuring automatically in %d second.
Your watch will start measuring automatically in %d seconds.
Your watch will use the reading as the first measurement result for calibration.
Now you can take a blood pressure measurement on your watch. Wear the watch on the same wrist as worn during calibration.
Keep the watch and cuff on. Follow instructions on the next screens to continue the calibration process.
Make sure your watch is on your non-dominant wrist, and your cuff is on the opposite arm.
Fit the Blood Pressure Monitor cuff on the arm opposite your watch.
Keep the watch and cuff on. Take the last measurement to complete calibration.
Enter the readings from your Blood Pressure Monitor:
Get notification when watch requires calibration.
Enter a valid date of birth.

This Samsung Health Monitor U.S. Privacy Policy explains the privacy practices of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. and its subsidiaries and affiliates (Samsung, we, us, our) with respect to the information collected through the Samsung Health Monitor application, connected applications, services and accounts, and associated accessories (Samsung Health Monitor). This Privacy Policy supplements, and should be read in conjunction with, the Samsung Privacy Policy, available at https://account.samsung.com/membership/pp, which provides additional information on Samsung’s privacy practices.

"We may collect and store the following information that you provide directly or generate through your use of Samsung Health Monitor: • in-app usage information (menus and settings clicked, features used (frequency and duration of use), and errors occurred)."
"We may use this information to: • deal with the error or unexpected event, as well as enhance a user experience and strengthen stickiness through statistical analysis."

We maintain administrative, technical and physical safeguards designed to protect personal information we obtain through Samsung Health Monitor against accidental, unlawful or unauthorized destruction, loss, alteration, access, disclosure or use.

This Privacy Policy may be updated periodically and without prior notice to you to reflect changes in our personal information practices with respect to Samsung Health Monitor. We will indicate at the top of the notice when it was most recently updated.

To update your preferences, update or correct your information, submit a request or ask us questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us by email at NAPrivacy@sea.samsung.com or write to us at:
"Privacy Office Samsung Electronics America, Inc. 85 Challenger Road Ridgefield Park, NJ 07660"
Samsung Health Monitor U.S. Privacy Policy

SAMSUNG HEALTH MONITOR may help you manage your overall fitness and wellness by providing relevant reference information and tools, including tools to help you track your activities and manage your wellbeing. SAMSUNG HEALTH MONITOR’s available functions, features, and additional applications may vary from country to country. You should check the features and applications available in your specific region. You can also use SAMSUNG HEALTH MONITOR and manage your data.

"SAMSUNG HEALTH MONITOR may make available certain services, connecting devices, websites, and software from third-party service providers (“Third-Party Services”), provided and powered by third-party providers, that will enable you to directly communicate with such providers’ content, devices, and/or software (“Provider”). The Providers are independent of Samsung and SAMSUNG HEALTH MONITOR does not furnish any of the Providers’ services itself, but rather offers a platform on which you may interact directly with the Providers and their services. You hereby acknowledge and agree that any Third-Party Services are being provided to you by the Provider and not by Samsung. Samsung is not responsible for the accuracy, reliability, timeliness, and completeness of information contained in any Third-Party Services, or for the security or safety of using them. Samsung is not practicing medicine or any healthcare profession through its offer of such Third-Party Services. Your interactions with Providers are not intended to take the place of your relationship with your regular healthcare providers. Samsung does not evaluate, recommend, endorse, or check the credentials of any Third-Party Services. Samsung does not protect, monitor, or otherwise have access to any information you share with Third-Party Services."
